IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: GUIDING STUDENTS TO SUCCEED THROUGH PERSONAL INSTRUCTION AND INTELLECTUAL INQUIRY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: GUIDING STUDENTS TO SUCCEED THROUGH PERSONAL INSTRUCTION AND INTELLECTUAL INQUIRY.
IRS990.Desc: MISSOURI VALLEY COLLEGE TAKES GREAT PRIDE IN OFFERING A FOUR-YEAR, HIGHLY PERSONALIZED EDUCATION, OFFERING OVER 35 MAJORS AND 5 PRE-PROFESSIONAL PROGRAMS; 16 SPORTS AND 29 VARSITY TEAMS; STUDENTS SERVED INCLUDE FULL-TIME FALL 1366, PART-TIME FALL 65, FULL-TIME SPRING 1205, AND PART-TIME SPRING 64.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: STUDENT SCHOLARHIPS, MAINTENANCE OF THE COLLEGE'S FACILITIES AND FUNDING OF FACULTY CHAIRS
FINANCIAL AID (NETTED WITH REVENUE ON AUDIT) 16,730,199.

DURING FISCAL YEAR 2013, THE COLLEGE PERFORMED A REVIEW OF SELECTED GIFT INSTRUMENTS AND INVESTMENT FUNDS THAT REPRESENTED A PORTION OF ITS ENDOWMENT FUND. AS A RESULT OF THIS REVIEW, THE COLLEGE IDENTIFIED CERTAIN INVESTMENT ACCOUNTS THAT WERE PREVIOUSLY REPORTED AS A PART OF TEMPORARILY RESTRICTED ENDOWMENT FUNDS THAT WERE INSTEAD UNRESTRICTED. IN ADDITION, THE COLLEGE IDENTIFIED AN INDIVIDUAL DONOR FUND THAT WAS PREVIOUSLY REPORTED AS PART OF THE UNRESTRICTED ENDOWMENT WHERE THE GIFT INSTRUMENT DID NOT SUPPORT THAT CLASSIFICATION. SUCH GIFT WAS INTENDED BY THE DONOR TO BE A PERMANENTLY RESTRICTED ENDOWMENT, THE INCOME OF WHICH IS RESTRICTED FOR SCHOLARSHIPS. AS SUCH, THE NET ASSET CLASSIFICATIONS AS OF JUNE 30, 2012 HAS BEEN RESTATED.
ALL ADVERTISEMENTS AS WELL AS WEBSITE STATE RACIALLY NONDISCRIMINATORY
THE COLLEGE RECEIVES FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID AND MISSOURI GRANTS TO DISBURSE TO STUDENTS

EACH YEAR APPLICANTS ARE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE AN ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATION. THE FINANCIAL AID STAFF VERIFY THE INFORMATION REPORTED ON THE APPLICATION AND AWARD EACH SCHOLARSHIP TO A QUALIFIED CANDIDATE. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE DOES NOT AWARD ANY AID TO A STUDENT WHO IS NOT ENROLLED. EACH SEMESTER A LIST OF ENROLLED STUDENTS IS COMPARED TO A LIST OF STUDENTS WHO HAVE BEEN AWARDED ANY TYPE OF FINANCIAL AID.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PRESIDENT REVIEWS FIRST AND THEN DISTRIBUTES TO THE BOARD MEMBERS FOR THEIR REVIEW BEFORE FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IF THERE ARE ANY CHANGES IN CONFLICT OF INTEREST, THEY ARE ADDRESSED IMMEDIATELY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PRESIDENT AND EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MEET IN A CLOSED SESSION EVERY FEBRUARY TO DISCUSS THE PRESIDENT'S COMPENSATION AS WELL AS THE OTHER OFFICERS. THE MEETING INCLUDES REVIEW OF COMPARABILITY DATA AND CONTEMPORANEOUS SUBSTANTIATION OF THE DECISION REACHED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COLLEGE HAS NO SET POLICY ON THE RELEASE OF ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF SPLIT-INTEREST AGREEMENTS 38,496.
THE COLLEGE HAS NOT CHANGED ITS PROCESS FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT AND SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT SINCE PRIOR YEAR.
